article.Heading: Budget 2016: Rupee opens lower by 9 paise at 68.69 per dollar
article.Summary: The Indian rupee opened lower by 9 paise at 68.69 per dollar versus 68.60 Friday.
article.Body:
The Indian rupee opened lower by 9 paise at 68.69 per dollar on Monday versus 68.60 Friday.

According to Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian, there is more scope for lowering of interest rates by the RBI as inflation is under control.

"There is scope for easing monetary policy in two ways, one to inject liquidity to bring it in line with the current policy rate and second is given our inflation projections and assessment going forward, perhaps there is more scope for easing the policy rates as well," he said.

With inputs from PTI
